intro: Arracacia wigginsii, commonly known as Wiggins' arracacia, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of dense forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
